remarks: The group sum depends only on the base set and additive operation.  Note that for entirely unrestricted functions, there can be dependency on out-of-domain values of the operation, so this is somewhat weaker than ~ mndpropd etc.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 18-Sep-2015.)
statement:
gsumpropd.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. V ) $.
gsumpropd.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. W ) $.
gsumpropd.h $e |- ( ph -> H e. X ) $.
gsumpropd.b $e |- ( ph -> ( Base ` G ) = ( Base ` H ) ) $.
gsumpropd.p $e |- ( ph -> ( +g ` G ) = ( +g ` H ) ) $.
gsumpropd $p |- ( ph -> ( G gsum F ) = ( H gsum F ) ) $.
